definitions.text: similar things placed in order or happening one after another
examples: they were investigating a series of bank robberies

definitions.text: a periodical that appears at scheduled times
(sports) several contests played successively by the same teams
examples: the visiting team swept the series

definitions.text: (electronics) connection of components in such a manner that current flows first through one and then through the other
examples: the voltage divider consisted of a series of fixed resistors

definitions.text: a group of postage stamps having a common theme or a group of coins or currency selected as a group for study or collection
examples: the Post Office issued a series commemorating famous American entertainers
his coin collection included the complete series of Indian-head pennies

definitions.text: (mathematics) the sum of a finite or infinite sequence of expressions
